author: Racheli
instructions:
1. Cook spaghetti until al dente.
2. In a separate pan, fry the bacon until crispy.
3. In a bowl, beat the eggs and mix in grated Parmesan cheese, black pepper, and salt.
4. Drain the cooked spaghetti and add it to the pan with bacon.
5. Pour the egg mixture over the spaghetti and toss until coated.
6. Serve immediately.

author: Yarin
instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a mixing bowl, cream together unsalted butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar.
3. Add an egg and vanilla extract to the mixture and mix well.
4. In a separate bowl, combine all-purpose flour, baking soda, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until well combined.
6. Stir in chocolate chips.
7. Drop spoonfuls of dough onto a baking sheet.
8. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.
9. Allow the cookies to cool on a wire rack before serving.

author: Geula
instructions:
1. Slice the tomatoes and mozzarella cheese into thick slices.
2. Arrange the tomato and mozzarella slices on a plate, alternating them.
3. Place fresh basil leaves on top of the tomato and mozzarella slices.
4. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
5. Sprinkle with salt and black pepper.
6. Serve immediately.

author: Yarin
instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Peel, core, and slice the apples.
3. In a pan, melt the butter and add the apples. Cook until the apples are softened.
4. Add the granulated sugar, brown sugar, flour, and cinnamon to the pan. Stir until the apples are coated.
5. Roll out one pie crust and fit it into a pie dish.
6. Pour the apple mixture into the pie crust.
7. Roll out the second pie crust and place it over the apples. Cut slits in the top crust to allow steam to escape.
8. Beat the egg and brush it over the top crust.
9. Bake for 50-60 minutes or until the crust is golden brown.
10. Allow the pie to cool before serving.

author: Solange
instructions:
1. Soak chickpeas in water overnight.
2. Drain chickpeas and blend with chopped onion, garlic, parsley, coriander, cumin, salt, and baking soda in a food processor until a thick paste forms.
3. Form the mixture into small balls and let rest for 15 minutes.
4. Heat vegetable oil in a deep pan and fry the balls until they are golden brown.
5. Serve with tahini sauce and fresh vegetables.

author: Avigail
instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 220°C (425°F).
2. Roll out the pizza dough and place it on a baking sheet.
3. Spread tomato sauce over the dough.
4. Add fresh basil leaves.
5. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese on top.
6. Drizzle with olive oil and add a pinch of salt.
7. Bake for 15-20 minutes until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly and slightly browned.
8. Let the pizza cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
